instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820 2914, No image
threads.message:
Hey guys, 

This machine don't show image... I already replace a GPU and still the same.. I can hear the sound when i miss the password in osx... i put a pen in usb and i see her working.. I have a apple LCD cinema and when i connect her i have a black screen and i hear the same sound when i miss the password.. The board looks fine no liquid damage... suggestions?? Thank you

threads.title: 820 2914, No image
threads.message:
Whats the date code on the GPU you replaced ?

Firstly, I would inspect the board for knocked off or missing components.

threads.title: 820 2914, No image
threads.message:
DC:1716, until now i never had a problem with this chips! i already inspect the board for missing components and it's look well! 

what i find strange is, usually this machines when enter in my store comes with a problem for exemple: distorted image, don't enter in OS X, white image... when it comes with no image is because some other guy try to reball and fail... it's only like that.. But i know the problem may be from the chip.. in the moment i don't have anyone..

threads.title: 820 2914, No image
threads.message:
I'm certain DC:1716 are polished up dead chips.

No point trying another until new chips are made.

threads.title: 820 2914, No image
threads.message: Oh yeah the $23 chips from Aliexpress. You will all be seeing these back in 3 months!
